item.title: New Box Folder for Shared Library Documents
item.dc:creator: Julia Kochi
item.description:
As we use UCSF Box more for sharing documents, it’s getting harder to find documents and folders.  To help combat this problem, a new folder has been created called Library Shared Folder that everyone can use to place documents (or folders) that all staff should have access.  Some existing folders have been ...

Read moreNew Box Folder for Shared Library Documents

item.title: Reminder: Nominate someone for a Campus STAR Spot Awards 2017-2018
item.dc:creator: Julia Kochi
item.description:
We’re halfway through the year, so please consider nominating a eligible staff members (see eligibility list) for a $1,000 STAR Spot Award. What is a STAR Spot Award? Cash awards designed to recognize significant employee achievements and contributions for a specific project or task over a relatively short period. To ...

Read moreReminder: Nominate someone for a Campus STAR Spot Awards 2017-2018

item.title: Welcome Sophia Prisco!
item.dc:creator: Julia Kochi
item.description:
By now I hope most of you have met Sophia Prisco, our new Education Librarian.  Sophia will be joining the Education group and will be focusing on experimenting and incorporating new technologies in our education programs.  She is also the product manager for LibGuides and work with staff to update, ...

Read moreWelcome Sophia Prisco!

item.title: Megan Laurance moving on!
item.dc:creator: Julia Kochi
item.description:
Megan will be moving on from the Library and joining UCSF’s Helen Diller Family Comprehensive Cancer Center’s Molecular Oncology Initiative in a full-time position.  Some of you may know that Megan has been working with this group 2 days a week since April and on a similar project with the ...

Read moreMegan Laurance moving on!

item.title: WebEx Training: October 6th
item.dc:creator: Julia Kochi
item.description:
Many of us use ReadyTalk for conference calls and screen sharing, but WebEx is the new kid on the block.  The Library is planning on moving away from ReadyTalk and using WebEx by the end of the year since it’s free to us and is pretty easy to use. In ...

Read moreWebEx Training: October 6th

item.title: Data Services and Assessment Librarian interview – July 18
item.dc:creator: Julia Kochi
item.description:
As I mentioned in the staff meeting, we’ll be interviewing Ariel Deardorff for the Data Services and Assessment Librarian position on Monday, July 18th.  Ariel will be giving a presentation entitled “Vision for UCSF Library-Based Data Science Services”  at 10am in room 201.  All staff are invited to attend as schedules ...

item.title: 2 Brown Bag presentations: Ben Goldacre (bad science) and Ellen Jorgensen (biohacking)
item.dc:creator: Julia Kochi
item.description:
At the Medical Library Association’s annual meeting this year, there were two interesting plenary speakers.  Ben Goldacre talked about “bad science” and got the New England Journal of Medicine bothered enough that they sent an email to all MLA attendees.  Ellen Jorgensen spoke about Genspace, a makerspace-like biolab, and citizen ...

Read more2 Brown Bag presentations: Ben Goldacre (bad science) and Ellen Jorgensen (biohacking)

item.title: New position: Data Services and Assessment Librarian
item.dc:creator: Julia Kochi
item.description:
We have a new librarian position open:  Data Services and Assessment Librarian.  Here’s a summary blurb.  For the full description, please see https://aprecruit.ucsf.edu/apply/JPF00924.  Please feel free to pass on the description to anyone you think might be qualified and interested.  To ensure full consideration by the search committee, apply by June ...

item.title: Staff spreading the word – Ariel Deardorff, Sarah McClung, Peggy Tahir, and me
item.dc:creator: Julia Kochi
item.description:
Library staff were busy in May presenting at conferences internationally (!) and locally. Ariel, Sarah (in absentia), and I  presented at the Medical Library Association’s meeting in Toronto.  It was a joint meeting with the Canadian Health Libraries Association and the International Clinical Librarian Conference. Ariel presented on a project she ...

item.title: Staff in Print – Ariel Deardorff and Peggy Tahir
item.dc:creator: Julia Kochi
item.description:
In April, both Ariel and Peggy published papers but in very different areas.  Ariel published a review of the data visualization software Tableau in the Journal of the Medical Library Association (JMLA).  The piece highlights features of Tableau, why and how people might use it, and covers the differences between the versions ...

Read moreStaff in Print – Ariel Deardorff and Peggy Tahir
